reviewText: I'm sorry to not jump on the "Curtains" bandwagon.  Finally watched it on YouTube and it was just okay.  There was a total and complete lack of character development.  All of the actresses were interchangeable.  And though it's usually par for the course, I found this film disturbingly misogynistic.  Rape fantasies?  Really?  And two visits to the casting couch; one with a guy they never even identified.  The ice skating scene was cool and the killer was appropriately creepy, but what was with the creepy dolls?  It's never explained.  Honestly, the ending felt like they ran out of film, mostly because of an endless and boring chase scene.  And the mansion?  More like a farmhouse, in my opinion.  I do believe it deserves its due in a restored version with the original artwork intact.  Maybe I will give it another look then.
Title: N/A

reviewText: One of the most highly anticipated dvd releases for horror fans is Curtains and just like about 90% of the people who want it, I didnt know it was released on dvd. The picture quailty is good and alot better then what people give credit it for. It does look like it was copied off a video but I like dvds like that. It adds a kind of a charm to it. While it may not be a stand alone dvd, it's probably the only way you can get it on dvd. Just like many other horror dvds, the cover is dumb and not the much better, original vhs cover.Secerts of The Clown is plain stupid and not worth your time. I'm not afraid of clowns but they can be really good in a horror film but every clown film since 2000 on has been crap. Hoboken Hollow looked pretty good and had a good cast, diffently will check it out. Room 33 i've yet to watch it.Overall, you can this at any major store for five bucks. I only got this for Curtains and i'm not disappointed by my purchase. Check it out yourself.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If your looking up "The Midnight Horror Collection: Bloody Slashers" then your probably here due to the fact that this quadruple feature contains the 1983 horror classic "Curtains." This seemingly forgotten slasher has been begging for a DVD release for years but don't get your hopes up too high. Echo Bridge Entertainment is a bargain company that I have a love/hate relationship for. Some of their releases contain decent transfers ("Prom Night", "Howling IV", "Ghoulies IV") and some of their transfers are nothing more than VHS ports ("She-Wolves of the Wasteland", any Bruceploitation release). Sadly the transfer of "Curtains" is a full screen VHS transfer, albeit a watchable VHS transfer, so this is not exactly the DVD release you have been patiently waiting for. The transfer is also a little on the dark side so it makes some sequences a little hard to see on but on the bright side there are no compression issues resulting in digital blocking, which is a plus.This quadruple feature release is a double sided disc that features two films on each side. The other films featured on this release are "Room 33" (letterboxed widescreen), "Hobokon Hollow" (full screen), and "Secrets of the Clown" (letterboxed widescreen). These films were made in 2007, 2005, and 2009 and  are nothing more than crummy no budget horror films that are not worth your time. "Secrets of the Clown" is especially bad and looks like a homemade movie. Out of all four of these films "Curtains" sticks out like a sore thumb as it is the only one from the 80's and for the fact it is the only film on the release that actually has production quality. I would have actually preferred to have "Curtains" to be released by itself without the other films infecting the release. I also have to complain about the cover artwork as the artwork for "Curtains" is horrible! Look up the original poster artwork or the old Vestron VHS cover... it's amazing! Echo Bridges artwork for Curtains makes it look like a modern piece of horror drek... just like the other three films on the release!I sold my VHS years ago (a mistake I later regretted) so I was happy to see "Curtains" finally released on DVD and picked it up for only $5. If you already own an old VHS version that you have transferred to DVD then it isn't worth "upgrading" to this release. If you don't own this film then it is definitely worth picking up for a cheap price. I'm glad I did but prepare yourself for a VHS transfer. Perhaps someday Echo Bridge will release a decent transfer of the film. They re-released an anamorphic widescreen version of "Prom Night" so it is a possibility...
summary: "Curtains" is finally on DVD, but don't get your hopes up
Title: N/A

reviewText: This review is strictly for the movie CURTAINS and not for the other three movies on the disc.Also, make sure to check out my horror movie review blog at: brandoncsites.blogspot.comCurtains (1983) *** / 4D: Richard CiupkaC: John Vernon, Samantha Eggar, Linda Thorson, Anne Ditchburn, Lynne Griffin, Lesleh Donaldson, Sandee CurrieP: World renowned actress (Eggar) has herself locked away in an insane asylum at the urging of her film director (Vernon) in order to research a film role. However, after the director leaves her there and moves on with a casting call at a secluded mansion, she breaks out and joins 5 other hopeful actresses looking for their big break, but someone is killing off the competition.Troubled horror film production in which filming was halted for over a year, one of lead actresses was fired from production with all of her scenes being re-shot, rotating crew, numerous turns at the editing table and a cast & crew that were left wondering if the film was ever going to be completed. As a result, the overall film is uneven and disjointed at times, but when it comes to the film's suspense sequences, that's where Curtains shines. These sequences are stylishly directed, well paced and do an above average job of creating mood, tension and atmosphere. There's a very suspenseful cat and mouse element to these scenes.Curtains isn't without its flaws and there are some plot holes, but when it comes to delivering on the idea
summary: Seems like most people want this DVD strictly for the movie Curtains

reviewText: Scraped from the bottom of what barrel!?I couldn't even make it past the first few frames of SECRETS OF THE CLOWN.  What secret, that this was the lowest of low budget fare?  No real actors were involved so they must have figured no acting was required.  Also cringe-worthy, HOBOKEN HOLLOW; I didn't manage to get far with it either (proof that "real" actors are also perfectly capable of committing atrocities in the name of acting...not that I ever expect much from C. Thomas Howell).  I did, however, manage to make it all the way through ROOM 33.  I'm not particularly proud of that fact but there it is.  What do you get when you mix roller derby queens with hitchhikers and a girl capable of conjuring up a killer dad?  Crap called ROOM 33.Let's face it, I only wanted CURTAINS.  But!  I did want a decent copy of it though and this isn't it.  Too dark by half (and that means most of the film), I had to fill in a lot of the story by memory!  This is not the way I want to view this movie.Not a keeper as I'm impatiently waiting for a better copy of Curtains...dare I hope, on Blu-ray?

reviewText: Why 80's cult horror film "Curtains" is accompanied by these 3 disasterpieces is beyond me. However, "Curtains" had not been released offically on dvd till this 4 pack. It's 4 films on 1 disc.  "Room 33" & "Hoboken Hollow" share side A and "Curtians" & "Secrets of the Clown" share side B. I guess if this is the only way I can get "Curtains" on dvd.. I'll take it! I didn't have high hopes for the other 3 films from the start but I gave each of them a fair chance. Here is a rundown for you..CURTAINS: Frankly, the only reason to buy this set. As several women audition for a major film role, they begin to die one by one. Is one of them sure to get the part or is there something more going on here? The creepy old lady mask score points and the ice skating scene is priceless.HOBOKEN HOLLOW: Several known actors appear in this major misfire. Don't let the eerie atmosphere fool you. Everything else about this film is way lame. Oh my goodness, the police are working with the town psycho's again, so no one is safe. People in fear of their lives are usually pumped with more adrenaline than these unbelievable characters here. Several times you question why they don't just run when they're working alone in the fields ect. Skip it.ROOM 33: Cars breakdown, cell phones have no signal, cats jump out and more! An abandoned group of people stumble upon an insane asylum in the middle of no where. The asylum hasnt been opened for years and of course horrible things have happened there. Now, a teen girl with a demonic voice is abandoned at the asylum and when one girl witnesses this odd behavior, she just walks out in the hall and shakes her head instead of getting the hell out of dodge! Lets just say the girls never make it to the Roller Derby which was their original destination.SECRETS OF THE CLOWN: The acting is so bad I thought I was watching a porno. This one is just an obvious attempt to scare people that have a clown phobia. Which it might do considering that all it takes is "a clown" in that case. A better title might have been "The Clown Whisperer" since I still don't know the secret of the clown after my viewing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Just wanted to let people know that you can get "Curtains" at a cheap price. It was released on DVD for Halloween time in a 4 movies pack. It is listed on here under The Midnight Horror Collection which includes "Curtains" and 3 other films. It was releasaed by Echo Bridge home entertainment. You can get this DVD very cheap. A little less than $5.00 shipped on here. The artwork for "Curtains" is different on the DVD, than the original VHS Vestron rerlease, but it is still the same great 80's classic movie. I would much rather have this on DVD at a great price than paying over $70.00 for a VHS release anyway. I am giving this a 5 star rating because of "Curtains". "Room 33" is okay and I would give it 3 stars. The other 2 movies are really not that good at all. The clown one is the worst. Skip it completely, unless you are bored. Grab this DVD quick. This is the only version of "Curtains" available on DVD ever. Who knows if it will ever get a seperate release. You can't beat the price. Once these go out of print, these will be impossible to find. If you do, the DVD price will go insane when people realize this contains the original 1980's classic of curtains. I think alot of people don't know yet because of the artwork being different for "Curtains". Grab this 4 pack. You will enjoy it.

reviewText: I have the VHS and a DVD transfer of Curtains. It should have been released on it's own, but this will have to do for now. There is such a nostalgic atmosphere to this classic 80's slasher. It stars other slasher girls from Black Christmas, Happy Birthday To Me, and The Brood. The hag on the ice skates and the chase in the prop room are scenes I rememeber watching as a kid. I bought this but really hope it gets the release it deserves!
summary: CURTAINS. finally. The only reason to own this DVD
Title: N/A

reviewText: Most buyers of this DVD seem to want it for CURTAINS. I don't blame them. In my opinion, CURTAINS is the best slasher film of the 1978-86 cycle sparked byHalloween(1978) (with the possible exception ofHalloweenitself).If you want to know why CURTAINS is so great, check out my extended review ofCurtains's VHS edition.But what of this DVD? Alas, as others have observed, it does not do CURTAINS justice. While the film is easily 5 stars, this version only deserves 3 stars. Major problems include ...* Murky visuals. This DVD version is so dark, sometimes it's hard to discern any details in the nighttime scenes. My old Beta tape of this film is visually superior to this DVD version.* Fullscreen -- or is it? Yes, it plays fullscreen, so that buyers have speculated that it was struck from an old VHS copy. But then I noticed that the faces appeared slightly squeezed. So I hit the "Widescreen" button on my TV, so that the film was stretched out -- and it looked fine! Or were the faces a wee bit too wide?So I'm not sure if this "fullscreen" version is actually a squeezed widescreen that only needs to be stretched out. I THINK it looks a little better (more normal) in widescreen mode. So is it widescreen? I'm not sure, but it may be.Even so, the visuals are very dark and murky, such that CURTAINS still cries for a digitally remastered, PROPER widescreen release. And interviews with the leading actors and directors (I understand the original director was replaced at one point).As for the other films...*Room 33is a decent, albeit unoriginal, low-budget supernatural thriller. Some young people, stranded in an abandoned asylum, are picked off by an evil ghost. Professional acting and creepy atmosphere. Some of the ghost effects seem inspired byThe RingandThe Grudge. Forgettable but entertaining. 3 stars.*Secrets of the Clownis about witchcraft and an supernatural clown doll, plus a demon that looks like a clown. This is a more amateurish production than is ROOM 33. The acting is worse, yet I wasn't bothered by it. The dialog appears dubbed in, giving the film a cheap feeling. The makeup and special effects are pretty good. There are some decent shocks. I enjoyed this film, despite its rough "first-time filmmaker" production values. A generous 3 stars, because I wasn't bored.* HOBOKEN HOLLOW is the weakest of the bunch. I couldn't sit through most of it. It seems to be about an evil farm family who kidnaps drifters, forcing them to work on their farm. Occasionally they torture and kill the drifters. A low-budget film; sordid, mean-spirited, and boring. 1 star.

reviewText: Was excited that the obscure Canadian flick "Curtains" has finally been released on DVD. Bad news is that the transfer is murky, with terrible image quality, and bad hissy sound (looks like a public domain DVD print). I'm glad I have it, since my VHS copy is rotting away, and I'm hoping they give this film the transfer it deserves in the near future.
